titleInfo.title: Front cover of "A, B, C of the Invisible Empire, the Knights of the Ku Klux Klan"

mods.abstract: Front cover of the pamphlet, "A, B, C of the Invisble Empire, Knights of the Ku Klux Klan." It features a central image of a hooded Klan member above the words, "Faultless, Fearless, and Forever Faithful," and the dates, "1866 - Founded" and "1915 - Incorporated." It asks for "an urgent call to real men" from Imperial Wizard Col. W. J. Simmons.

titleInfo.title: War and Reunion - The Lost Cause in Southern Memory

relatedItem.abstract: As the nineteenth century drew to a close, the seeds of Southern mythology idealizing the service of the Southâ€™s aging Confederate veterans began to take root. Defeated militarily, in the decades following 1865 the South struggled to vindicate the decisions that had led to secession and to an armed conflict that had cost so many men their lives. From the ashes of war and the turbulence of the Reconstruction period, a cultural identity took shape, grounded in ideas and attitudes referred to collectively as the Lost Cause...
